citeinfo.title: Family and Child Care Centers, Minnesota 2018

descript.abstract: This suite of data is a collection of layers that communicate the locations of child care centers and family child care in Minnesota. It was created by downloading licensing information from the MN Department of Human Services (DHS), and geocoding the addresses of the resulting records. Note: while the DHS licensing download also includes a license type of "Certified Child Care Center", no records resulted from a search of that license type at the time of this dataset's creation. Thus, that license type is not included in this collection. Follow the links below to the individual metadata pages for each layer: Child Care Centers - Programs licensed to provide care to children for less than 24 hours a day in a commercial setting. Family Child Care - Programs licensed to provide care to children for less than 24 hours a day, typically in the providerâ€™s home or a local space, including a church.
descript.purpose: To provide state agencies and the general public with a basic overview of the locations of child care centers and family child care locations.

timeperd.current: Data was downloaded in May 2018, and geocoded in June 2018. MnGeo plans to update this information annually.

idinfo.useconst: The use of this data is conditioned on acceptance of the DHS terms and conditions outlined at https://licensinglookup.dhs.state.mn.us/Disclaimer.aspx

overview.eaover: See information in individual metadata records included in this folder.

distinfo.distliab: MnGeo's data disclaimer is online: http://www.mngeo.state.mn.us/chouse/disclaimer.html The DHS disclaimer is also online: https://licensinglookup.dhs.state.mn.us/Disclaimer.aspx

stdorder.ordering: This data set is distributed via the Minnesota Geospatial Commons and is accessible via the online linkage below.

procstep.procdesc: See information in individual metadata records included in this folder.
